summary: During the pandemic , Congress provided more than $52 billion in supplemental funding to help keep child care providers in business and ensure that low-income families could still access care. In this testimony, we discuss our work on how states used those funds, e.g., waiving family co-payments and increasing payments to care providers. States are still spending the money, and a full picture of its...
title: Child Care: Observations on States' Use of COVID-19 Pandemic-Related Funding
